derivation.yuyuan_name: early 16th cent. (in the general senses 'short written note' and 'a licence or permit'): shortening of obsolete French étiquet, from Old French estiquet(te), from estiquier 'to fix', from Middle Dutch steken. Compare with etiquette

entry.tran: (剧院、运动场、表演等的)入场券，门票，票
entry.def: A ticket is a small, official piece of paper or card which shows that you have paid to enter a place such as a theatre or a sports ground, or shows that you have paid for a journey.

example.ex: I queued for two hours to get a ticket to see the football game...
example.tran: 我排了两个小时的队，就是为了买张足球赛的票。

example.ex: I love opera and last year I got tickets for Covent Garden...
example.tran: 我喜爱歌剧，去年我搞到几张科芬园皇家歌剧院的票。

entry.tran: (交通)罚款通知单，违章通知单
entry.def: A ticket is an official piece of paper which orders you to pay a fine or to appear in court because you have committed a driving or parking offence.

example.ex: I want to know at what point I break the speed limit and get a ticket.
example.tran: 我想知道我是在什么地方超速而受到处罚的。

entry.def: A ticket for a game of chance such as a raffle or a lottery is a piece of paper with a number on it. If the number on your ticket matches the number chosen, you win a prize.

example.ex: She bought a lottery ticket and won more than $33 million.
example.tran: 她买了张彩票，中了3,300多万美元。

entry.tran: (竞选时所代表的)政党;(竞选时所支持的)纲领，政见
entry.def: The particular ticket on which a person fights an election is the party they represent or the policies they support.

example.ex: He first ran for president on a far-left ticket...
example.tran: 他第一次代表极左政党参加总统竞选。

example.ex: She would want to fight the election on a ticket of parliamentary democracy...
example.tran: 她想以实施议会民主制为纲领去参加竞选。

entry.def: A ticket is the list of candidates who are representing a particular political party or group in an election.

example.ex: He plans to remain on the Republican ticket for the November election.
example.tran: 他计划继续代表共和党参加 11 月份的选举。

entry.def: If you say that something is just the ticket, you mean that it is exactly what is needed.

example.ex: Young kids need all the energy and protein they can get and whole milk is just the ticket.
example.tran: 儿童需要摄入足量能量和蛋白质，而全脂牛奶正好能满足这一需求。

means.word_mean: 1. a commercial document showing that the holder is entitled to something (as to ride on public transportation or to enter a public entertainment)
2. a summons issued to an offender (especially to someone who violates a traffic regulation)
3. a list of candidates nominated by a political party to run for election to public offices

sentences.sentence: "this car could be just the ticket for a small family"

means.word_mean: 1. issue a ticket or a fine to as a penalty;

sentences.sentence: "I was fined for parking on the wrong side of the street"
"Move your car or else you will be ticketed!"

means.word_mean: 2. provide with a ticket for passage or admission;

example.en: Bill works as a ticket chopper at Victoria Station.
example.zh: 比尔在维多利亚车站当检票员。

Sentence.sentence: More than half of their time is spent directing traffic and writing parking tickets.
I was so grateful, " Aarons says, " but I persuaded Pat to let me return the favour in my own way with season tickets to our little theater group.
Well, I guess I'd sell my watch or computer or do some odd jobs till I could afford a return plane ticket.
Excuse me, can I get a ticket for a sleeping compartment on this train?
But I can't find a ticket anywhere.
She can get a ballet ticket for the man

sentences.en: Please show your ticket to the stewardess when you board the plane.
sentences.cn: 登机时请向空中小姐出示机票。

means.word_mean: （商店中标明货物价格、尺码等的）标签

sentences.en: The sales ticket says the coat is 2００.
sentences.cn: 这件外套售价标签上标明是200美元。

means.word_mean: 交通违规的通知单, 罚款单

sentences.en: The driver got a ticket for speeding.
sentences.cn: 司机超速行驶, 接到违章罚单。

sentences.en: The governor ran on the Democratic ticket.
sentences.cn: 州长参加了民主党的竞选。

jushi.english: At home, we feel frustrated.But, if you go to Africa you have a ticket to opportunity when you return home.
jushi.chinese: 在国内我们感到失望,不过,你到非洲一趟,回来后你就有了资本,机会就来了。

jushi.english: She's very handsome and she's very finely dressed, only somehow she's not the ticket, you see.
jushi.chinese: 她长得很漂亮,穿得很雅致,只是总有点不大对劲。

jushi.english: Could you get me some tickets for tonight's show?
jushi.chinese: 请给我弄几张今晚演出的票好吗?
